docs.lead_paragraph: Relieving some of the political pressure for reform, the Government released new actuarial studies today extending the date at which Medicare can be expected to run out of money by seven years and Social Security insolvency by two years. The improved financial position of the Medicare and Social Security trust funds is largely the result of the strong economy over the last year, the trustees of the funds said in their annual report.

headline.main: Longer Solvency for Medicare and Social Security

docs.abstract: Government releases new actuarial studies extending date at which Medicare can be expected to run out of money by seven years, to 2015, and Social Security insolvency by two years, to 2034; improved financial position of Medicare and Social Security trust funds is largely result of strong economy over last year, trustees of funds say in their annual report; Pres Clinton says that despite good news, legislation strengthening programs should still be enacted this year; photo (M)
